main event: Observers sighted three red lights in the sky over Waterloo, Iowa, on April 12, 1966.
interesting points: The lights were described as being the size of stars, The observation lasted for 15 minutes, The lights demonstrated slow, erratic motion with no noise, Witnesses included reliable civilians and policemen, The report concluded the sighting resembled aircraft despite no identifying features.
sighted object: three red lights in the sky
witness description: civilians and policemen, including an air traffic control specialist
